body.segment: On a two-year stack basis, group sales increased 78% on a constant currency basis.
Repeat customer contribution profit was £86 million relatively flat with the prior year,
driven by 13% increase in repeat customer sales on a constant currency basis
and offset by higher logistics and transportation costs due to the global supply chain disruption.
We invested £41 million in acquiring new customers,
which was less than we did in fiscal year 2021,
when we accelerated to capture the decrease in acquisition costs during COVID-19 lockdowns.
To put our fiscal year 2022 investment levels in context,
it was 76% higher than we did in fiscal year 2020.
And importantly, we delivered adjusted EBIT profit of £2 million,
driven by a strong demand from existing numbers and strong expense control.
Turning now to costs.
Gross profit was £142 million with a gross margin of 40%,
which is a 60 basis point increase over the prior year,
driven by a higher mix of repeat versus new customer sales,
as well as improvement in Australia gross margins.
Fulfillment costs as a percentage of total sales were slightly higher in fiscal year 2022 at 18% of total sales versus 17% in the prior year.
The increase was primarily driven by increased logistics and transportation costs.
During the year we implemented automation in our UK distribution center
and remodeled our U.S. distribution network.
